title: Cyber bullying : common types of bullying 2019 , by gender
summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of students on the Y-axis for 4 different Responses for 2 groups Male, and Female that are presented on the X-axis.

Out of all 2 groups, Female had the highest Share of students in Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) and Female had the lowest Share of students in Response I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days).

Among all the Responses, Female had the highest Share of students 387.0 in Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) and lowest value 46.0 in Response I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days).
There is a gap of 341.0 between the highest and lowest Share of students found for Female in Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) and I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days).
min_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of students on the Y-axis for 4 different Responses for 2 groups Male, and Female that are presented on the X-axis.

Out of all 2 groups, Female had the highest Share of students in Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) and Female had the lowest Share of students in Response I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days).
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of students on the Y-axis for 4 different Responses for 2 groups Male, and Female that are presented on the X-axis.

Out of all 2 groups, Female had the highest Share of students in Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) and Female had the lowest Share of students in Response I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days).

Among all the Responses, Female had the highest Share of students 387.0 in Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) and lowest value 46.0 in Response I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days).
There is a gap of 341.0 between the highest and lowest Share of students found for Female in Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) and I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days).
max_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of students on the Y-axis for 4 different Responses for 2 groups Male, and Female that are presented on the X-axis.

Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) had the maximum Share of students among all 2 groups, and it was for Female. The minimum Share of students was observed in Response I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days) for Female.
In Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime), Female had the maximum Share of students and it saw the lowest in Response I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days) out of all 4 Responses.
Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) and I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days) had the biggest gap of 341.0 between the highest and lowest Share of students found for Female.
Out of all 2 groups, the highest gap between the maximum and minimum Share of students was found in case of Male.

On average, the Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) had the highest Share of students for all 2 groups Male, and Female. Whereas I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days) had the lowest average Share of students.

data.Response: I have been cyber bullied (previous 30 days)
